name: Aussie Word Wise Quiz | Brain Teasers | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Back of Bourke.

	Typical Aussie statement to describe somewhere as being the 'back of Bourke' is to say that it's a fair way away from anywhere else, particularly in the Outback!

Down Under.

	Australia is known as the 'Land Down Under', but, if you're an Aussie you know we're really 'Up Over'!

Good On Yer Mate.

	Typical Aussie form of praise - Good On Yer Mate!

Redback on the Toilet Seat.

	In the words of a famous Aussie song, 'There was a Redback on the toilet seat when I went there last night ....' - not a frivolous call, I remember many a night visiting the 'thunderbox' wondering what creepy crawlies were sharing my visit with me!

Poke In The Eye.

	Poke in the eye, typically, 'Better than a poke in the eye with a burnt stick'!

Outback.

	More than half of the Australian continent is referred to as the Outback!

Four X.

	Four X - a brand of Queensland beer!

questions.correct: The Dog Sat On The Tuckerbox
questions.explanation:
The Dog Sat On The Tuckerbox.

	In Gundagai, a rural town in New South Wales, there is a statue of a Dog sitting on a Tuckerbox - it relates to the words of a famous Australian 'ditty'.

Underdog.

	Australians love to barrack for the 'underdog' whether it's in sport, politics or in real life!

Top Sheila.

	A complimentary term for an Australian female!
